metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3117 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Duplicate of CVE-2023-3390.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3117` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-26-generic - 6.2.0-26.26
linux-image-6.2.0-26-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-26.26
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-26-generic - 6.2.0-26.26
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-26-generic-64k - 6.2.0-26.26
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1008-aws - 6.2.0-1008.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> seems like it is a duplicate for CVE-2023-3390. will likely be rejected.

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-26.26').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage now end-of-life').
linux-aws package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1008.8').
